# Gradio: Build Machine Learning Web Apps with Python

**Gradio empowers you to effortlessly create and share interactive web apps for your machine learning models with just a few lines of Python!**  ([See the original repo](https://github.com/gradio-app/gradio))

Gradio is an open-source Python package that streamlines the process of building demos and web applications for your machine learning models, APIs, or any Python function. Share your creations with ease using Gradio's built-in sharing features.  No complex web development knowledge is required!

## Key Features

*   **Rapid Prototyping:**  Quickly build interactive demos in minutes, ideal for experimentation and showcasing your models.
*   **Easy Sharing:** Generate shareable links with a single line of code, making it simple to share your work with anyone, anywhere.
*   **No Web Development Required:**  Avoid the complexities of JavaScript, CSS, and web hosting; Gradio handles the heavy lifting.
*   **Flexible Component Library:**  Utilize a rich set of pre-built components (text boxes, images, sliders, etc.) tailored for machine learning applications.
*   **Customizable Layouts:** Design sophisticated web apps with custom layouts and data flows using `gr.Blocks`.
*   **Chatbot Creation:**  Easily build chatbot interfaces using `gr.ChatInterface`.
*   **Python & JavaScript Ecosystem:** Leverage the power of Gradio's ecosystem, with Python and JavaScript clients for programmatic interaction.
*   **In-Browser Development:** Write Gradio apps entirely in the browser using Gradio-Lite.

## Getting Started

### Installation

**Prerequisite**:  Gradio requires [Python 3.10 or higher](https://www.python.org/downloads/).

Install Gradio using `pip`:

```bash
pip install --upgrade gradio
```

> [!TIP]
 > It is best to install Gradio in a virtual environment. Detailed installation instructions for all common operating systems <a href="https://www.gradio.app/main/guides/installing-gradio-in-a-virtual-environment">are provided here</a>.

### Build Your First Demo

Create a simple demo:

```python
import gradio as gr

def greet(name, intensity):
    return "Hello, " + name + "!" * int(intensity)

demo = gr.Interface(
    fn=greet,
    inputs=["text", "slider"],
    outputs=["text"],
)

demo.launch()
```

> [!TIP]
 > We shorten the imported name from <code>gradio</code> to <code>gr</code>. This is a widely adopted convention for better readability of code.

Run the code (e.g., `python app.py`).  Your demo will be accessible in your browser (typically at `http://localhost:7860`).

![`hello_world_4` demo](demo/hello_world_4/screenshot.gif)

### Sharing Your Demo

Share your demo with a public URL using the `share=True` argument in `launch()`:

```python
import gradio as gr

def greet(name):
    return "Hello " + name + "!"

demo = gr.Interface(fn=greet, inputs="textbox", outputs="textbox")

demo.launch(share=True)  # Share your demo üöÄ
```

## Core Gradio Classes

*   `gr.Interface`: The core class for creating demos with an input function, input components, and output components.
*   `gr.Blocks`:  Offers a low-level approach for designing web apps with customizable layouts and data flows.
*   `gr.ChatInterface`:  A high-level class for quickly building chatbot UIs.

## The Gradio Ecosystem

Gradio is more than just a library; it's a whole ecosystem:

*   [Gradio Python Client](https://www.gradio.app/guides/getting-started-with-the-python-client) (`gradio_client`): query any Gradio app programmatically in Python.
*   [Gradio JavaScript Client](https://www.gradio.app/guides/getting-started-with-the-js-client) (`@gradio/client`): query any Gradio app programmatically in JavaScript.
*   [Gradio-Lite](https://www.gradio.app/guides/gradio-lite) (`@gradio/lite`): write Gradio apps in Python that run entirely in the browser (no server needed!), thanks to Pyodide.
*   [Hugging Face Spaces](https://huggingface.co/spaces): the most popular place to host Gradio applications ‚Äî for free!

## Further Exploration

*   [Gradio Guides](https://www.gradio.app/guides/): Step-by-step tutorials.
*   [API Documentation](https://www.gradio.app/docs/): Technical reference.
*   [Building Interfaces guide](https://www.gradio.app/guides/the-interface-class)
*   [Building with Blocks guide](https://www.gradio.app/guides/blocks-and-event-listeners)
*   [gr.ChatInterface guide](https://www.gradio.app/guides/creating-a-chatbot-fast)

## Gradio Sketch

Build Gradio applications without writing code using Gradio Sketch.  Type `gradio sketch` in your terminal, or [use the hosted version on Hugging Face Spaces](https://huggingface.co/spaces/aliabid94/Sketch).

## Questions?

For bugs and feature requests, create an [issue on GitHub](https://github.com/gradio-app/gradio/issues/new/choose).  For general usage questions, join the [Discord server](https://discord.com/invite/feTf9x3ZSB).

If you like Gradio, please give us a ‚≠ê on GitHub!
